structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: This course aims to introduce and explore contemporary political developments in East and Southeast Asia.
description.et: Kursuse raames käsitletakse kaasaegseid poliitilisi arenguid Ida- ja Kesk-Aasias.

objectives.en: This course will provide a comparative study of political developments in East and Southeast Asia since the 20th century in the context of ethnic and cultural differences, and democratic and economic development. The course has two main objectives, firstly to understand the characteristics of East Asia regimes and secondly to explore alternative options for democratisation in the region.
objectives.et: Kursus annab võrdleva ülevaate Kirde- ja Kagu-Aasia poliitilisest arengust 20.-21. sajandil, käsitledes seda etniliste ja kultuuriliste erinevuste ja demokraatlike ning majanduslike arengute kontekstis. Kursuse raames vaadeldakse Ida-Aasia režiimide iseloomulikke jooni ja demokratiseerumise alternatiive regioonis.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completing this course, students will:
*	understand the political development in one part of the world (Northeast and Southeast Asia) in relations to the broader patterns of change in the world;
learning_outcomes.et: * mõistab Kirde- ja Kagu-Aasia poliitilist arengut suhetes maailma muutuste laiemate mustritega;

learning_outcomes.en: *	comprehend the challenges of contemporary political development in the region;
learning_outcomes.et: * mõistab piirkonna kaasaegse poliitilise arengu väljakutseid;

learning_outcomes.en: *	be able to compare and evaluate patterns of political development to make assessments concerning future events in the area;
learning_outcomes.et: * on võimeline võrdlema ja hindama poliitilise arengu mustreid, et anda hinnanguid piirkonna tulevaste sündmuste kohta;

learning_outcomes.en: *	be able to express their analytical opinions and conclusions about the political development of the region both in oral and written form.
learning_outcomes.et: * on võimeline väljendama oma analüütilisi arvamusi ja järeldusi piirkonna poliitilise arengu kohta nii suulises kui ka kirjalikus vormis.

description.en:
Participation in seminars (5)
Assessment criteria:
-	active participation: regular attendance and class discussion;
-	elaborate relevant readings: small quiz in the beginning of the seminar.

It is expected that the students attend and participate actively in the class meetings; include and refer to the readings when participating; formulate their thoughts and communicate their arguments clearly.

Missing seminars can be compensated by answering the seminar quiz in written format but for that only half of the in-class points (i.e 5 pts) can be obtained, no matter the reason for missing a class.

description.en:
Short in-class quizzes or reflections (up to 2 pts) for participation in the 8 class meetings which are not seminars or presentation sessions. Basically, they are for taking note of your attendance.

These quizzes/ reflections cannot be compensated for - if you miss a class, you will not be able to collect these points.
description.et:

grade_preconditions.en: There is no separate final assignment, the course will have assignments throughout the semester. To earn a final grade, a student should complete all assigned readings and complete at least element from each assignment category (seminars, presentation, peer feedback, in-class quizzes/ reflections). The minimum result for passing the course is 51%.
grade_preconditions.et: There is no separate final assignment, the course will have assignments throughout the semester. To earn a final grade, a student should complete all assigned readings and complete at least element from each assignment category (seminars, presentation, peer feedback, in-class quizzes/ reflections). The minimum result for passing the course is 51%.

grade_evaluation.en:
1) Participation in in-class seminars (5x10 pts) 50 pts;
2) In-class presentation + written memo 25 pts;
3) Peer feedback (2x4.5 pts) 9 pts;
4) Attendance (in-class quizzes) (8x2 pts) 16 pts.

Max result: 100 pts

A: 91-100%
B: 81-90%
C: 71-80%
D: 61-70%
E: 51-60%
F: <51%

resources.mandatory_materials:
Following is a preliminary reading list; an updated version will be provided in class.
* Cheng, J. Y. S., Lodén, T., & Stünkel, L. (2022). Politics in East Asia Today: Between Democracy, Debates. https://isdp.eu/content/uploads/2022/01/Politics-in-East-Asia-Today-14.01.2022.pdf
* Chu, Y. H., & Huang, M. H. (2010). The Meanings of Democracy: Solving an Asian Puzzle. Journal of Democracy, 21(4), 114-122.
* Chu, Y. W. (2021). Democratization, globalization, and institutional adaptation: The developmental states of South Korea and Taiwan. Review of International Political Economy, 28(1), 59-80.
* Croissant, A., & Lorenz, P. (2018). Comparative Politics of Southeast Asia. An Introduction into Government and Politics. Cham: Springer.
* Fukuyama, F. (2012). China and East Asian Democracy: The Patterns of History. Journal of Democracy, 23(1), 14-26.
* Guo, Y. (2019). From Marxism to nationalism: The Chinese Communist Party's discursive shift in the post-Mao era. Communist and Post-Communist Studies, 52(4), 355-365.
* Hayes, L. D. (2012). Political Systems of East Asia: China, Korea, and Japan. ME Sharpe.
* Lawrence, S. V., & Martin, M. F. (2013). Understanding China's political system.
* Thompson, M. R. (2004). Pacific Asia after 'Asian values': authoritarianism, democracy, and 'good governance'. Third World Quarterly, 25(6), 1079-1095.
* Thompson, M. R. (2015). Democracy with Asian characteristics. The Journal of Asian Studies, 875-887.
* Soong, J. J. (2022). The Political Economy of Asian States and Their Development Strategies under USA-China Power Rivalry: Conducting Hedging Strategy on Triangular Relation and Operation. The Chinese Economy, 1-11.
